file_content.text: Officially, what happened with Doctor Lorrick never happened. But unofficially, that was nice work.
Chief Rannos is waiting for you.
Master Jedi. Name's Whisper. My boss needs to speak with you. The fate of the Republic is at stake.
Sir. Name's Whisper. My boss needs to speak with you. We have a situation that requires Havoc Squad's unique touch.
Captain. Name's Whisper. My boss needs to speak with you about an urgent--and potentially profitable--matter.
Name's Whisper. My boss needs to speak with you. Top priority.
Give me a second to set up a secure connection... okay, boss--you're good to go.
This is Chief Rannos, of Republic SIS. I've been looking over your files. Obviously, I'm impressed.
You're quite the collection of heroes. The Republic wouldn't be here if it wasn't for you. Just the kind of team I need for this job.
You went toe-to-toe with the Emperor and came out on top. That's the kind of person I need for this job.
The Republic couldn't have survived without the Rift Alliance. That was nice work. Exactly the kind of thing I'm looking for on this job.
Taking out General Rakton turned the tide of the war. You know how to get things done. Just what I need for this mission.
You did a nice job getting Shariss Kartur out of a tight spot. When this mission came up, first person I thought of was you.
You've got quite the track record. Just the kind of agent I need for this mission.
My order is sworn to defend the Republic. I take that vow seriously.
The Jedi won't let you down.
This time the threat is a little different. We don't think the Empire is involved.
I doubt this mission involves the Empire; our recent victories have left them too weak to challenge us directly.
I sense a new enemy has risen.
You're right. We don't think the Empire is involved. But that doesn't make the situation any less dire.
Wouldn't want Havoc Squad's skills to get rusty.
I'm always looking for action.
No fear of that. The Empire may be staggering, but they aren't the only threat to the Republic.
I miss the good old days. You know, when I wasn't the first person everyone turned to when they needed a hero.
Not sure I like being famous.
It can't be all that bad. I hear saving the galaxy can be very lucrative. Look at this job as a business opportunity.
You didn't need to send an agent to track me down. It's not like I'm hard to find.
Why all the cloak-and-dagger?
This is a delicate political matter. Discretion is required.
Give me the details.
You heard of the Tion Hegemony? It's an independent sector located along key hyperspace shipping lanes. Wealthy, powerful and stubborn.
We've been trying to form an alliance with them for years. So have the Imps. Neither side has made much progress.
Our recent battles with the Empire have drained resources from both sides. The Tion Hegemony is more valuable than ever.
If you're looking for someone to negotiate a treaty, you better look somewhere else.
I'm not a diplomat.
I understand, Chief Rannos. You want me to negotiate the terms of an alliance.
You want to secure a treaty.
Negotiation was the original plan. But things have gone off the rails. Big time.
Exactly how strong are they? Any chance they might try to take on the Republic?
Are they a threat?
Let's just say we've been keeping a close eye on them. Good thing, too.
Sounds like SIS business.
Time to drop the bombshell, Chief.
We intercepted a series of classified transmissions. The Tion Hegemony's in trouble. Their worlds are being overrun by rakghouls!
Unchecked, the rakghoul outbreak will be catastrophic. Billions will be infected. We're looking at the planet-wide annihilation of all civilized life.
The rakghoul plague has been successfully contained to a single world for centuries.
How did they get off Taris?
Figuring out how it spread to other worlds is of vital importance. The outbreak needs to be contained.
The Imperials were experimenting with rakghouls on Taris. They must have decided to take their research offworld.
The Empire's behind this.
That's one possibility. But the Empire's fighting just to stay alive. Why would they mess with the Tion Hegemony now?
I'm on my way!
Not so fast. The Republic has no authority in the Tion Hegemony. You can't just go barging in.
This is a delicate situation. We still don't have all the details, and the Tion royal family isn't talking.
We need to meet face-to-face to figure out our next step. Whisper will give you the location of my ship. Rannos out.
Here's the boss's coordinates. He'll be waiting for you. And if this is as bad as it seems, you better hurry.
Don't mind me. Just scoping things out.
